creator: ralikwen@hotmail.com
text: It would be nice if we could expand/collapse all the selected nodes at once.

creator: captrespect@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27008
Adds some expand all/ collapse all buttons

Here's a patch to all expand all / collapse all buttons above the tree.  You'll also need to place the 2 gifs in the org.apache.jmeter.images directory

creator: captrespect@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27009
ExpandAll gif

Expand All gif from the eclipse project.

Created attachment 27010
Collapse All gif

Collapse all gif for the button from the eclipse project.
creator: captrespect@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the patch, however it contains TAB characters.
This has caused some spurious changes to be generated.

Please can you regenerate the patch without the TABs?

It's a lot easier to review patches that only change the minimum necessary, i.e no reformatting or other such changes.

Thanks.

creator: captrespect@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 27011
Same patch, less tabs

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Thanks, but there is still at least one tab in the patch, and there are various other changes which are nothing to do with the new feature, for example changing the indentation of some lines.

Some of the new lines are indented 9 spaces, which is non-standard - we use 4 spaces per indent level.

Patches should only include the code (and any related comments) which is need to implement the change.

Created attachment 27012
Same patch less spaces...
creator: captrespect@gmail.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Sorry, but that patch is no better than the previous one. There are lots of spurious changes.

If your IDE is configured to "auto-fix" anything (e.g. remove trailing spaces), turn that off.

creator: captrespect@gmail.com
text: Ugh, im not going to go revert and recode.  I just formated using the sun standard in eclipe, with the tabs turned off. There aren't many other line changes, it probably wont cause any conflic problems. Feel free to use it or dont.

Hello,

Rules formatting for Eclipse:
http://wiki.apache.org/jakarta-jmeter/JMeterEclipse

Generally, you don't needs formatting all the source code for each file impacted by your patch, just for the new code.

I will send a correct file for your patch
creator: milamber@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 27016
Patch with only new code
creator: milamber@apache.org

text:
(In reply to comment #11)
> Created attachment 27016 [details]
> Patch with only new code

Thanks very much, that's much easier to read.

There's one strange line of code:

+        } catch (IllegalUserActionException e1) {
+            log.equals(e);              <============ ???
+        }

I presume that should be log.error(e)?(In reply to comment #2)
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #2)
> Created attachment 27009 [details]
> ExpandAll gif
> 
> Expand All gif from the eclipse project.

This is presumably under the EPL 1.0, which is not 100% compatible with the Apache License. It's not clear whether it's OK to include the gif or not.
Similarly for the other GIF.

There are already menu items (with keystrokes) for both functions.

Does not seem necessary to add buttons as well, especially since no other functions have buttons.

However, at some point it might make sense to add a button bar for all the major functions, so changing the resolution to LATER.

At that point, the issue of the button licensing can also be addressed (or new buttons can be created).
creator: sebb@apache.org
